page.title: 08Housing
page.content: During the last two decades the pattern of life in towns is changed: dwellers in towns can now afford to buy old cottages, refurbish them and use them for weekends and holidays. Although this does give a more prosperous appearance, it prevents local people from getting a home in the land where they have grown up, because such cottages attract high prices. This valley has many such homes, which makes life for the scattered and some elderly residents lonely in the winter. The village school was made into a bungalow in the most attractive way but is at the moment up for sal, for after being restored by a local man, resold, and again offered at a price so high that no young couple could possibly afford to buy.
